image.altText: A man stands and looks at the camera outside a damaged building.

props.synopsis: While Israel's war on Iran claimed hundreds of Iranian lives and dozens in Israel, Palestinian villages were being showered by missile debris and interceptor shrapnel.

title.children: Falling missile debris smashes West Bank villages and terrifies residents

image.altText: two hands grasping prison bars

props.synopsis: The number of people behind bars in Australia has risen to more than 46,000, but a law expert warns anyone who says the best way to reduce crime is to raise the imprisonment rate "is a complete idiot".

title.children: Australia's prisoner numbers hit all-time high

image.altText: Elon Musk stands in the Oval Office.

props.synopsis: Billionaire Elon Musk doubles down on his distaste for President Donald Trump's sprawling tax and spending cuts bill, hours before it was narrowly cleared.

title.children: Musk reignites criticism of Trump's tax bill, says it will 'destroy' jobs

image.altText: People gathering giving a press conference outside a court

props.synopsis: Antoinette Lattouf's unlawful sacking has exposed how lobby groups pressure the media.

title.children: Antoinette Lattouf's unlawful sacking exposed the power of lobbying on the Australian media

image.altText: A man in a white windbreaker points toward the sky as he raps into a microphone

props.synopsis: British authorities are reviewing footage of several performances at the Glastonbury Festival after two musical acts led their audiences in controversial chants.

title.children: Police investigate Glastonbury acts as controversial set goes ahead

image.altText: A freight train travels through the outback with mountains in the distance.

props.synopsis: Most "fresh" food travels thousands of kilometres to be sorted, divvied up and, in some cases, sent back to the place it came from — at huge cost to farmers and shoppers. But some new options are starting to sprout.

title.children: From freight to plate: The 'mind-boggling' journey of 'fresh' food

image.altText: A man holding a caracal

props.synopsis: Under the cover of darkness, and with artillery fire just kilometres away, Marcus Fillinger rescued an emaciated wolf that had been abandoned for weeks in a private zoo in Ukraine.

title.children: Why this Aussie drove a sedated wolf through war-torn Ukraine

image.altText: Darcy Fogarty with the ball for Adelaide Crows against Richmond.

props.synopsis: Two teams at opposite ends of the ladder face off as Richmond hosts Adelaide at the MCG. Later on Sunday, Fremantle looks to entrench its position inside the top eight with a clash against St Kilda. Follow live.

title.children: Adelaide's early inaccuracy keeps Richmond within striking distance

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Lefau subbed out after calf injury upon return
Richmond vs Adelaide team news - No late changes

image.altText: A rugby league player with a head guard on holds the ball as a player in blue tries to tackle him

props.synopsis: Two of the NRL's more inconsistent teams meet in a Titans-Cowboys Queensland derby on the glitter strip after the Storm smashed the Sharks in Melbourne. Follow live.

title.children: Titans and Cowboys clash in basement battle after Storm smash Sharks

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 78' Sualauvi Fa'alogo has done a hamstring!
HT: Storm leads Sharks in a tight one

image.altText: Brian To'o shouts on the ground.

props.synopsis: NSW coach Laurie Daley will name Brian To'o in his team to face Queensland in the decisive third State of Origin match.

title.children: Blues make big call on Origin winger To'o after knee injury

image.altText: Jeff Bezos on a boar in black wearing sunglasses as Lauren Sanchez Bezos makes prayer hands

props.synopsis: Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sánchez Bezos's wedding in Venice continues to anger locals.

title.children: Bezos wedding sparks more protests on last day of extravaganza

image.altText: A close up image of Tony Burke in a suit and tie.

props.synopsis: Immigration Minister Tony Burke says High Court-ordered revisions have made the preventative detention regime unworkable and he is instead focused on paying countries to take members of the NZYQ migrant cohort.

title.children: Burke concedes preventative detention laws for migrants have failed

image.altText: A selfie of a man with a beard and blue eyes, standing in front of a white wall.

props.synopsis: Authorities will put "more boots on the ground" in a multi-agency search for Christopher Moore, 38, who failed to return home after a solo camping trip in NSW south coast bushland.

title.children: Search for missing hiker ramps up ahead of forecast wet weather

image.altText: A woman stands in front of apartment buildings.

props.synopsis: Australia's YIMBY movement is relatively new, but it is making an impact and each member has their own housing struggle spurring them on.

title.children: The deeply personal reasons Australians call themselves YIMBYs

image.altText: A B-2 Spirit bomber seen against a grey sky.

props.synopsis: Very few pilots know what it's like to fly a B-2 stealth bomber for more than 30 hours straight. But a couple of those who do reveal what goes on inside the cockpit on a marathon mission.

title.children: Pilots reveal realities of marathon B-2 bomber missions

image.altText: Mamdani stands below a sign that reads 'afford to live, afford to dream'

props.synopsis: It was a primary race that pitted competing visions for the Democratic Party against one another, and in the end, the New York progressives emerged victorious. They now believe they have the momentum to change their party.

title.children: In NYC, a young socialist just defeated the Democratic establishment

image.altText: A young couple assist a fuel station attendant to service their car.

props.synopsis: Some independent petrol stations still offer old-fashioned driveway service but it's "very unusual".

title.children: Whatever happened to driveway service at petrol stations?

image.altText: A group of people stand around an ancient greek temple, dressed in summer clothes one woman holding an umbrella for shade.

props.synopsis: The temperature has been nearing 40 degrees Celsius in parts of Europe as the first heatwave of the summer hits continent.

title.children: European heatwave sends temperatures soaring

image.altText: Massive crowd of people waving rainbow flags on bridge

props.synopsis: Tens of thousands of protesters march through Hungary's capital as a banned LGBTQIA+ rights rally swells into a mass anti-government demonstration.

title.children: Hungary's banned Pride rally morphs into anti-government march

image.altText: Valdas Bieliauskas was stuck in the water for 22 hours

props.synopsis: When a white-water rafter fell into the Franklin River, it triggered an extraordinary rescue mission that pushed everyone to the brink.

title.children: Inside the moment rescuers knew they had to harm a dying man to save him

image.altText: A coastal town next to blue water with sail boats

props.synopsis: As people in southern Australia flock to the tropics for the winter holidays, some popular destinations are looking to crack down on short-stay accommodation.

title.children: New limits on short stays proposed for Whitsunday region

image.altText: A man in riot gear in orange smoke.

props.synopsis: Serbian police in riot gear clash with anti-government protesters demanding snap elections and an end to President Aleksandar Vučić's 12-year rule.

title.children: Serbian police clash with anti-government protesters

image.altText: A woman stand while holding a photo of herself and her husband in a photo frame.

props.synopsis: Heather Hughes' husband fought toxic fires for decades. But when he died of cancer WorkSafe rejected her dependency claim, despite recognising it as an occupational illness.

title.children: Mick died of cancer but his family's compensation claim was rejected

image.altText: A collage of two photos, one shows a young man in a suit at a table with a device, the other an older man holding an incubator.

props.synopsis: They developed electric vans and scooters in the 1940s, invented a portable heart monitor and saved thousands of people suffering from polio, so why aren't the Both brothers household names in Australia?

title.children: The Both brothers invented more than 100 devices. Have you heard of them?

image.altText: A bowl of apple crisp with a scoop of vanilla ice cream and a spoon. A baking tray of apple crisp sits behind it.

props.synopsis: A just-baked dessert can bring much-needed cheer on cold nights. Whether you are craving cookies or have a passion for puddings, we have you covered.

title.children: Winter means puddings, crumbles and cake. Here are our top 10

image.altText: Team of scientists inspect antarctic ice core sample 2025-05-30 10:05:00

props.synopsis: Australian scientists have started analysing the first batch of samples from the "Million Year Ice Core" project.

title.children: Scientists analyse first samples from ancient Antarctic ice core

image.altText: Maya Joint smiles while holding up a large trophy

props.synopsis: Australian teenager Maya Joint receives the perfect pre-Wimbledon boost, winning the Eastbourne Open for her first grass-court title.

title.children: Maya Joint digs deep for maiden grass-court title at Eastbourne Open

image.altText: Saltbush country giving way to the ocean in the distance

props.synopsis: Eight Mirning ancestors are returned to their country, 140 years after a police report pointed to poisonings and murder on WA's Nullarbor Plain.

title.children: Outback burial tries to 'heal the hurt' more than a century on

image.altText: A woman wearing black prepares coffee at French-style cafe.

props.synopsis: Much of Australia's French-speaking population has found their chosen homes in Killarney Heights, fit with Parisian cafes, French language classes and champagne-stocked bottle shops.

title.children: How a sleepy Sydney suburb became the French capital of Australia

image.altText: Image shows authorities in neon green vests investigating a bookstore.

props.synopsis: Malaysian authorities raided this bookstore on Wednesday to seize two books on the grounds of morality. But for the bookstore staff and publishers, this is just another day.

title.children: The simple act of reading can be a crime in Malaysia. Here's why

image.altText: A man with blonde short hair and a singlet rests his hands on his chin and sits on the floor. PLayers in background.

props.synopsis: Country football clubs in Western Australia are finding new ways to address an alarming rate of suicide in men.

title.children: 'You are not alone': Country footy clubs tackle mental health

image.altText: A mock up of a train on the Suburban Rail Loop

props.synopsis: Suburban Rail Loop Authority transport planners have calculated how much faster people will be able to between various destinations along the SRL East between Box Hill and Cheltenham, which is scheduled to open in 2035.

title.children: Suburban Rail Loop may shave up to 40 minutes from travel times in Melbourne's east

image.altText: Police wagon on suburban driveway

props.synopsis: Police are investigating the death of a 44-year-old man, who was found unresponsive at Southport on Saturday night.

title.children: Crime scene declared after 'sudden death' of man on Gold Coast

image.altText: A camera.

props.synopsis: As smart cameras and AI transform photography, the past helps us understand the future.

title.children: Technology has evolved but has the reason we take photos changed?

image.altText: Man with cap and backpack holds a photo in one hand and a toy in the other in dwilight. Ute with headlights on in background.

props.synopsis: Broken Hill filmmaker Jason King is embarking on his most challenging project yet, telling his story of grief and loss after his daughter's death in the hope of helping others.

title.children: Father who lost 18yo daughter to suicide to honour her through film
